events.name: Google I/O Extended 2017 - Milton Keynes
events.description:
Come to the launch of GDG Milton Keynes!

17:00 - Registration and refreshments

18:00 - Keynote (streamed live from the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, CA)

20:00 - Refreshments and networking

20:30 - Announcements

21:00 - Developer keynote

22:00 - Close

events.name: General talks - Cloud Firestore, Cloud Functions and the GDPR
events.description:
Session 1:
There have been many changes to the Firebase Database in the last 12 months. We'll be taking a look at Cloud Firestore, how it differs to the Firebase RTDB and which you should use for your application. The talk will also discuss issues around latency, data sharding and solutions to common scenarios.

Session 2:
With the deadline for GDPR fast approaching, we'll be looking at essentials around compliance with the GDPR and how you can use Google Cloud's Data Loss Prevention API to redact / obfuscate data.

Session 3:
Just add code. We'll take a look at how Cloud Functions can be used to create fully managed, scalable, on-demand microservices, to transform data, manipulate images / audio or connect to 3rd party APIs.

Pizza and drinks
events.how_to_find_us:
Please use the entrance for Unit 25 (Skyline Taxis)

What 3 Words: redouble.gashes.robe

events.name: General talks - Cloud TTS & Cloud Functions
events.description:
Our monthly talks / hacks / meetups

This month, we'll be looking at Google Cloud's newest products.

Cloud Text-to-Speech
Google's Cloud TTS has been developed using DeepMind technology to create WaveNet voices, an amazing new era in text to speech, where more naturally sounding speech can be produced. Dolphin ONE were one of the launch partners for this product

Cloud Functions for Firebase v1.0.0
We'll show you what you can do with Cloud Functions and some of the changes in version 1
events.how_to_find_us: Please use the entrance for Unit 25 (Skyline Taxis).  Your sat nav may take you to the back door.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 Milton Keynes
events.description:
We'll be livestreaming the Google I/O keynote sessions along with activities during the break and an opportunity to win a Google Home Mini.

Venue: The Pinnacle, Transport Systems Catapult, 170 Midsummer Boulevard, Milton Keynes

17:30 - Registration and drinks

19:30 - Refreshments, retro gaming and networking (maybe a Code Lab)

events.name: Cloud Next 18 announcements / Tensorflow.js

Cloud Next '18 announcements
This month, we'll be taking a look at some of the announcements made at this year's Cloud Next 18 in San Francisco.

Using Tensorflow.js

This will also be our last meeting at the Transport Systems Catapult. They are downsizing and will no longer have the space available.

events.name: General talks

venue.name: GirlsCode Office, Block E, Bletchley Park
venue.address_1: Bletchley Park, next to the submarine model

events.description:
Our monthly talks / hacks / meetups. At our NEW location: The National Museum of Computing, Bletchley Park.

Tonight, we'll be taking a look at serverless technologies, such as Kubernetes, BigQuery, DataFlow, Cloud Build and the Firebase suite, looking at the RealTime Database, Authentication, Cloud Firestore and Cloud Functions. We'll focus mainly on the Javascript SDK for any demos. However, if anyone has any experience of Swift / Java / Kotlin / Flutter, please feel free to join in.

If you want to try some things out for yourself, bring a laptop. Ideally, you'll want to be running Linux or OS X.

events.name: General talks

venue.name: GirlsCode Office, Block E, Bletchley Park

events.description:
Our monthly talks / hacks / meetups.

This month we'll be covering a few of the announcements from Cloud Next London, the TensorFlow summit and the Firebase Summit, followed by a couple of workshops on NoSQL data modelling and TensorFlow.

events.name: Machine learning on Google Cloud
events.description:
This workshop will cover from beginners to in-depth content on Machine Learning on Google Cloud.

Starting from an introductory level, we will be advancing in difficulty with the succeeding sessions. Attendees will be able to take training material home and continue from there with support.

Agenda
This is a 4 hour training starting from 5.30 pm to 9.30 pm:
5:30 pm: Registration and refreshments
5:45 pm: A tour of Qwiklabs and GCP and getting started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
6:45 pm: Cloud Natural Language API: Qwik Start + Video Intelligence: Qwik Start
7:45 pm: Break
8:00 pm: Classify Images of Cloud Using Cloud ML API
8:45 pm: Implementing an AI Chatbot with Dialogflow
9:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 4 hours course, participants will be able to:
Get hands-on practice with the Google Cloud Platformâ€™s fundamental tools and services.
Understand how Qwiklabs platform works for personal practice.

Audience
You will come in with little or no prior cloud knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first GCP project.
Applicationâ€‹ â€‹developers, Web Developers,â€‹ â€‹Cloudâ€‹ â€‹Solutions Architects,â€‹ â€‹DevOpsâ€‹ â€‹Engineers,â€‹ â€‹IT managers.
Individualsâ€‹ â€‹usingâ€‹ â€‹Googleâ€‹ â€‹Cloudâ€‹ â€‹Platform toâ€‹ â€‹createâ€‹ â€‹newâ€‹ â€‹solutionsâ€‹ â€‹orâ€‹ â€‹toâ€‹ â€‹integrate existingâ€‹ â€‹systems, application environments,â€‹â€‹â€‹ â€‹andâ€‹ â€‹infrastructureâ€‹ â€‹with theâ€‹ â€‹Googleâ€‹ â€‹Cloudâ€‹ â€‹Platform.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little to no prior knowledge in cloud computing or with the Google Cloud Platform. It is expected that students have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with administering computing systems. Prior work with shell environments / command line interfaces will be helpful for completing the labs in this series.

The trainer
Abdallah Abedraba is part of the Developer Relations team at Google helping to drive developers success and awareness of the Open Standards & Google Technologies by working closely with Developer Communities. A third Palestinian, a third Kenyan and a third Spanish, he loves strongly typed programming languages, Free & Open Source Software, maths, chess, hiking and a good morning run! You can find him on Twitter at @aabedraba

events.name: An Introduction to Building Apps for the Google Assistant
events.description:
This combined talk and workshop will start at the beginners level on Building Apps for the Google Assistant.

Starting from an introductory level, you will gain an understanding of the basic concepts and consider use cases while getting hands on experience in practical workshops in this and succeeding sessions.

It begins with the Talk
Zero to App: Introduction to Building Apps for the Google Assistant

Actions on Google is an exciting way to interact with your users through the Google Assistant. It provides a conversational interface between you and your user, and these are simple to build with Dialogflow.
Not sure how to start developing your very first Action on Google?
Not to worry, in this talk, weâ€™ll cover everything from understanding the business use cases and the high level voice user interface (VUI) design best practices to implementation, testing, and, finally, publishing your app. By the end of this session, you should have a better understanding of the Assistant service ecosystem and how to get started.

We then move to a Workshop
Google Assistant Development 101: Foundation Hands-On Workshop

Actions on Google is a new, exciting developer platform that lets you extend the functionality of the Google Assistant across over 1 billion devices, including smart speakers, displays, phones, cars, TVs, watches, headphones, and more.
Curious about how to start developing your very first Action on Google? In this workshop, youâ€™ll learn how to build Google Assistant apps using Dialogflow and Firebase, test, and, finally, publish them. Weâ€™ll also explore the necessary concepts of voice user interface (VUI) and best practices for implementing Actions on Google that give users high-quality conversational experiences.

Agenda
This is a 2.5 hour training
10:00 am: Registration and refreshments
10:15 am: Talk - Zero to App: Introduction to Building Apps for the Google Assistant
10:45 am: Break
11:00 am: Google Assistant Development 101: Foundation Hands-On Workshop
12:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 2.5 hours training, you will be able to:
Understand why you should consider Building Apps for the Google Assistant for yourself or your company.
Get hands-on practice with the Google Assistant platform covering fundamental tools and services.

Audience
You will come in with little or no prior cloud knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first Google Assistant project.
Applicationâ€‹ â€‹developers, Web Developers,â€‹ â€‹Cloudâ€‹ â€‹Solutions Architects,â€‹ â€‹DevOpsâ€‹ â€‹Engineers,â€‹ â€‹IT managers.
Individualsâ€‹ â€‹thinking about creative new â€‹solutionsâ€‹ â€‹orâ€‹ â€‹toâ€‹ â€‹integrate existingâ€‹ â€‹systems, application environments,â€‹â€‹â€‹ â€‹andâ€‹ â€‹infrastructureâ€‹ â€‹with theâ€‹ â€‹Googleâ€‹ â€‹Cloudâ€‹ â€‹Platform.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little to no prior knowledge in cloud computing or with the Google Assistant or Actions on Google. It is expected that you will have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with computing systems. Bring your personal (not work) laptop and charger.

Your trainer
Dr. Aygul Zagidullina is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Assistant based in London, UK. Her work experience includes Google, Todoist, MotaWord. She holds a PhD in quantum chemistry and prior to Google dedicated 6 years to scientific research at the University of Stuttgart. Aygul is a very active member of the London digital ecosystem and has been involved in many innovative projects. She is a Google Developer Group (GDG) London lead, Google Women Techmakers (WTM) London ambassador, Google Launchpad mentor, Google Product Expert (PE), Google Trusted Tester (TT), AnitaB.org London lead, Women in Voice (WiV) London lead, and UK STEM Ambassador (Code Club and CoderDojo mentor, Devoxx4Kids UK co-organizer). She was named as one of The NEXT 100 Top Influencers of the European Digital Industry in 2013.
@aygul

events.name: Data Visualization in Google Data Studio: Developer Edition Talk and Workshop
events.description:
This combined talk and workshop will start at the beginners level on Data Visualization in Data Studio.

Starting from an introductory level, you will gain an understanding of the basic concepts and consider use cases while getting hands on experience in a practical workshop.

It begins with the Talk
Data Visualization in Data Studio: Developer Edition

Data Studio is Googleâ€™s serverless business intelligence and data visualization platform. As an easy and free-to-use reporting solution, Data Studio helps businesses and individuals to understand their data, derive key insights, effectively communicate measurements, and make better informed decisions.

In this talk, Yulan Lin discusses Data Studioâ€™s developer features: community visualizations and community connectors.

Community visualizations allow you to build custom JavaScript visualizations that integrate into your Data Studio dashboards, and community connectors allow you to connect basically any internet connected data source to your dashboard.

In the process, youâ€™ll learn about Data Studio, Google Apps Script, and writing data visualizations with JavaScript.

We then move to the Workshop
Walkthrough of Data Studio Community Visualizations and Community Connectors

This workshop will be an opportunity to work through the self-paced codelabs for community visualizations and community connectors with Yulan nearby to answer questions and provide additional context.

Agenda
This is a 2.5 hour training
6:00 pm: Registration and refreshments
6:15 pm: Data Visualization in Data Studio - Developer Edition
7:00 pm: Break
7:30 pm: Walkthrough of Data Studio Community Visualizations and Community Connectors
8:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 2.5 hours training, you will be able to:
Understand why you should consider Data Visualization in Data Studio for yourself or your company.
Get hands-on practice with the Data Visualization in Data Studio platform covering fundamental tools and services.

Audience
Data Viz/Analysts/Beginner & Intermediate developers with JavaScript experience - intended for developers familiar with Google platforms/products.
You will come in with little or no prior Data Studio knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first Data Visualization in Data Studio project.
Individualsâ€‹ â€‹thinking about creative new â€‹solutionsâ€‹ â€‹orâ€‹ â€‹toâ€‹ â€‹integrate existingâ€‹ â€‹systems, application environments,â€‹â€‹â€‹ â€‹andâ€‹ â€‹infrastructureâ€‹ â€‹with theâ€‹ â€‹Data Studio â€‹Platform.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little prior knowledge in Data Visualization in Data Studio.
It is expected that you will have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with computing systems and JavaScript.
Bring your personal (not work) laptop and charger.
We recommend having Chrome installed and you have a personal gmail account.

Your trainer
Yulan Lin is a Developer Advocate for Googleâ€™s Data Studio. She first fell in love with code because of SQL GROUP BY statements and RNA-sequencing, and her experience spans bioinformatics, nonprofits, and NLP.

When not computerating, she can be found studying for her Mastersâ€™ in Computer Science, hosting dinner parties, and playing the piano.

Check out her Twitter @y3l2n

events.name: Firebase: Build apps fast, without managing infrastructure - Talk and Workshop
events.description:
This combined talk and workshop will start at the beginners level on Firebase.

Starting from an introductory level, you will gain an understanding of the basic concepts and consider use cases while getting hands on experience in a practical workshop.

It begins with the Talk
Firebase Performance Monitoring

Firebase is Googleâ€™s comprehensive mobile development platform. With Firebase, you can build apps fast, without managing infrastructure. Firebase gives you functionality like analytics, databases, messaging and crash reporting so you can move quickly and focus on your users.

In this talk, Richie Foreman & Ali Kashefian Naieni discuss how having a performant web app is critical to the developers but it is hard to write apps which perform well on various device types. Quantifying performance and improve on it is another challenge. Using Firebase Performance Monitoring for the web, they will explain how you can measure exactly where time is being spent, and where you need to optimize your app.

We then move to the Workshop
Walkthrough of Firebase features and functionality

This workshop will be an opportunity to work through the self-paced codelabs for Firebase with Richie and Ali nearby to answer questions and provide additional context.

Agenda
This is a 2.5 hour training
6:00 pm: Registration and refreshments
6:15 pm: Firebase Performance Monitoring Talk
7:00 pm: Break
7:30 pm: Walkthrough of Firebase features and functionality
8:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 2.5 hours training, you will be able to:
Understand why you should consider Firebase for yourself or your company.
Get hands-on practice with Firebase platform covering fundamental tools and services.

Audience
Beginner & Intermediate developers - it doesn't really matter if you are back end or front end or somewhere in the middle.
You will come in with little or no prior Firebase knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first Firebase project.
Individualsâ€‹ â€‹thinking about creative new â€‹solutionsâ€‹ â€‹orâ€‹ â€‹toâ€‹ â€‹integrate existingâ€‹ â€‹systems, application environments,â€‹â€‹â€‹ â€‹andâ€‹ â€‹infrastructureâ€‹.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little prior knowledge in Firebase.
It is expected that you will have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with computing systems and databases.
Bring your personal (not work) laptop and charger.
We recommend having Chrome installed and you have a personal gmail account.

Your trainer
Richie Foreman is a full-stack software engineer with a background in customer-facing technical consulting and partner engineering roles.

He has a passion for beautiful web interfaces, maintainable software that makes sense, and drinking coffee.

If you can't make it, we have a live stream but only for the talk not the workshop so be there to get the most out of it:

Live stream - https://youtu.be/eMBB2Pk1NNs

events.name: Flutter: Build beautiful, natively compiled apps for mobile, web and desktop
events.description:
This combined talk and workshop will start at the beginners level on Flutter.

Starting from an introductory level, you will gain an understanding of the basic concepts and consider use cases while getting hands on experience in a practical workshop.

It begins with the Talk
Flutter 101

Flutter is Googleâ€™s UI toolkit for building beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase. With Flutter, you can paint your app to life in milliseconds with Stateful Hot Reload.

Use a rich set of fully-customizable widgets to build native interfaces in minutes. Flutterâ€™s widgets incorporate all critical platform differences such as scrolling, navigation, icons and fonts to provide full native performance on both iOS and Android.

In this talk, Swav Kulinski discusses Flutters features and how you can get started using it including how you can delight your users with Flutter's built-in beautiful Material Design and Cupertino (iOS-flavor) widgets, rich motion APIs, smooth natural scrolling, and platform awareness.

Find out how you can use Flutter's hot reload to help you quickly and easily experiment, build UIs, add features, and fix bugs faster.

We then move to the Workshop
Walkthrough of Flutter's features and functionality

This workshop will be an opportunity to work through the self-paced codelabs for Flutter with Swav nearby to answer questions and provide additional context.

Agenda
This is a 2.5 hour training
6:00 pm: Registration and refreshments
6:15 pm: Flutter Talk 101
7:00 pm: Break
7:30 pm: Walkthrough of Flutter features and functionality
8:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of this 2.5 hours training, you will be able to:
Understand why you should consider Flutter for yourself or your company.
Get hands-on practice with Flutter covering fundamental tools and services.

Audience
Beginner & Intermediate developers - it doesn't really matter if you are back end or front end or somewhere in the middle.
You will come in with little or no prior Flutter knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first Flutter project.
Individualsâ€‹ â€‹thinking about creative new â€‹solutionsâ€‹ â€‹orâ€‹ â€‹toâ€‹ â€‹integrate existingâ€‹ â€‹systems, application environments,â€‹â€‹â€‹ â€‹andâ€‹ â€‹infrastructureâ€‹.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little prior knowledge in Flutter.
It is expected that you will have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with computing systems and databases.
Bring your personal (not work) laptop and charger.
We recommend having Chrome installed and you have a personal gmail account.

Your trainer
Swav Kulinski is Lead Flutter Engineer at TAB (The App Business) with a background in development for Android applications, Gradle, jUnit, Robolectric and a bunch of other technologies.

He has a passion for Flutter and we are really, really lucky to have him coming to talk to us about it. Not one to miss!!!

We are going to be running this at the Natwest Accelerator Hub at Silbury House, 300 Silbury Boulevard in Milton Keynes for this event.

If you can't make it in person, we have a live stream but only for the talk not the workshop so be there to get the most out of it:

Live stream - https://youtu.be/9BJVQ534faQ

events.name: DevFest 2019
events.description:
GDG Milton Keynes are proud to announce our annual DevFest 2019 on:

Saturday 9 November 2019 at BSI Kitemark Court

Join new and experienced developers, entrepreneurs, local business leaders, attendees and special guests from the Milton Keynes and surrounding areas.

Experience keynotes, talks and get hands-on training in codelabs with Google expert trainers covering everything from Android, G Suite, Kotlin, Firebase, Machine Learning, GCP, Dialogflow, Google Assistant and much more.

So hurry to book your free slot at the Google DevFest Milton Keynes 2019 where you can spend a day geeking out, chatting to like-minded people and learning in a fun environment.

events.name: I Stream, YouTube Stream:How Do I Make My Video Stream? + Using AR/VR on the web
events.description:
Speaker:
Doug Sillars
https://www.linkedin.com/in/dougsillars/

Doug is is a freelance mobile performance expert, having helped thousands of developers speed up their mobile apps and websites.

A Google Developer Expert and the author of Oâ€™Reillyâ€™s â€œHigh Performance Android Apps,â€ Doug regularly speaks at conferences, and blogs at dougsillars.com.

He is currently working as a freelance digital nomad, traveling with his family in Europe.

Talk 1:
I Stream, You Stream: How Do I Make My Video Stream?

The use of video on the web and on mobile is growing. It is as easy as adding a video src=â€video.mp4â€, and youâ€™re good to go. But, all the top video sites (YouTube, Netflix, Hulu) all stream their video.

What do they know that we donâ€™t know? Is streaming more efficient? Do I need any special equipment to create or serve video streams?

In this talk, Doug explains how to create and stream videos, weigh the pros and cons of streaming vs. static videos, and see how easy it is to get started delivering streaming content on the web or to a mobile app.

Youâ€™ll look at the performance aspects of delivering video on the web, and how to improve the performance of video by using streaming instead of static videos.

Talk 2:
Building an ARt Gallery in the Browser

The world of virtual reality allows us to build new 3D interactive spaces that we can fill with anything we want - like the art of the great Renaissance masters. More into Cubism? With a quick click - now the gallery is full of a completely different genre.

With new Augmented Reality (AR) features, we can actually build the gallery in our own space - and just as easily swap out the art - all in our browser!

In this talk, weâ€™ll walk through the steps to build a virtual ARt gallery, with web technology available today, but also take a peek at the new WebXR technology that is coming to our browsers soon!

Agenda
This is a 2 hour session
6:00 pm: Registration and refreshments
6:15 pm: Talk 1 - I Stream, You Stream: How Do I Make My Video Stream?
7:00 pm: Break
7:30 pm: Talk 2 - Building an ARt Gallery in the Browser
8:30 pm: Workshop close

Objectives
At the end of the talks, you will be able to:
Understand why you should consider video streaming for yourself or your company.
See how easy it is to build a virtual ARt gallery.

Audience
Beginner & Intermediate developers - it doesn't really matter if you are back end or front end or somewhere in the middle.
You will come in with little or no prior video streaming or Augmented Reality knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first projects.
Individualsâ€‹ â€‹thinking about creative new â€‹solutionsâ€‹ â€‹orâ€‹ â€‹toâ€‹ â€‹integrate existingâ€‹ â€‹systems, application environments,â€‹â€‹â€‹ â€‹andâ€‹ â€‹infrastructureâ€‹.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little prior knowledge of the subjects.
It is expected that you will have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with computing systems and databases.
Bring your personal (not work) laptop and charger.
We recommend having Chrome installed and you have a personal gmail account.

If you can't make it, we have a live stream but you won't get to meet Doug personally and chat to him over pizza so be there to get the most out of it:

Live stream:
Talk 1
I Stream, You Stream: How Do I Make My Video Stream?
https://youtu.be/i7g3wnVd6lQ

Talk 2
Building an ARt Gallery in the Browser
https://youtu.be/iAKmK5gaRR0

Our preference is for you to book on Eventbrite rather than here (but do not book on both)
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/i-stream-you-stream-how-do-i-make-my-video-stream-using-arvr-on-web-tickets-83450575919
events.how_to_find_us: Head into the car park, which is a one way system and park in any free parking bay. Please RSVP so we can let security know who you are. You may not be allowed on the premises if you don't RSVP!!!

events.name: Flutter Interact: Viewing Party and meeting
events.description:
Flutter is Google's UI toolkit for building beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.

Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Flutter Interact is a day dedicated to creation and collaboration with the world, inspired by the makers of brilliant experiences.

App Makers from around the world will come together to share ideas, techniques and inspiration on Flutter.

Viewing parties are all about our remote audience, enabling Flutter advocates from across the globe to gather with their peers and experience the Summit within their own community.

The keynote will be followed by a meeting to discuss how we progress future meetups to run for Flutter.

Unfortunately Swav Kulinski, who was due to speak and run the codelab is unavailable however we are likely to have him visit us in January or February to give us the benefit of his knowledge!
https://www.linkedin.com/in/swavkulinski/

This is a 2 hour session
6:00 pm: Video Keynote
7:20 pm: Refreshments
7:45 pm: Meeting
8:00 pm: Workshop close

Beginner & Intermediate developers - it doesn't really matter if you are back end or front end or somewhere in the middle.
You will come in with little or no prior app development knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first projects.
Individualsâ€‹ â€‹thinking about creative new â€‹solutionsâ€‹ â€‹orâ€‹ â€‹toâ€‹ â€‹integrate existingâ€‹ â€‹systems, application environments,â€‹â€‹â€‹ â€‹andâ€‹ â€‹infrastructureâ€‹.

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little prior knowledge of the subjects.
It is expected that you will have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with computing systems and databases.
Bring your personal (not work) laptop and charger.
We recommend having Chrome installed and you have a personal gmail account.
